SENT.plain: The pathogenesis of brain infarctions, intracerebral hematomas and subarachnoidal hemorrhages is described

It is believed that defects in microcirculation are important factors in the development of brain infarctions, whereas hypertension and microaneurysms or vascular malformations are sources of intracerebral hematomas and subarachnoidal hemorrhages
Detection and differential diagnosis are presented from clinical aspects
Possibilities and limits of laboratory methods, especially CCT, are emphasized
